      • setCurrencyCode

        public PaymentParams.Builder setCurrencyCode(java.lang.String currencyCode)
        Sets the currency code.
        Parameters:
        currencyCode - 3-letter ISO4217 of Payment Currency Code
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setPaymentMethod

        public PaymentParams.Builder setPaymentMethod(java.lang.String paymentMethod)
        Parameters:
        paymentMethod - Expected values:
        CC – Credit Card (Online 3D/Non3D)
        MO– Credit Card (MOTO – Mail Order Telephone Order)
        DD – Direct Debit (not applicable to TransactionType AUTH)
        WA – e-Wallet (not applicable to Transaction Type AUTH)
        ANY – All payment method(s) registered with eGHL
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setTransactionType

        public PaymentParams.Builder setTransactionType(java.lang.String transactionType)
        Sets the transaction type.
        Parameters:
        transactionType - Expected values:
        SALE – Direct captured for credit card payment; Payment request for other payment methods
        AUTH– For credit card payment, authorize the availability of funds for a transaction but delay the capture of funds until a later time. This is often useful for merchants who have a delayed order fulfillment process. Authorize & Capture also enables merchants to modify the original authorization amount due to order changes occurring after the initial order is placed, such as taxes, shipping or item availability
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setServiceId

        public PaymentParams.Builder setServiceId(java.lang.String serviceId)
        Sets the service id.
        Parameters:
        serviceId - Merchant Service ID given by eGHL
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setPaymentId

        public PaymentParams.Builder setPaymentId(java.lang.String paymentId)
        Sets the payment id. You can use the EGHL.generateId(String) to generate an ID.
        Parameters:
        paymentId - Unique transaction ID/reference code assigned by merchant for this payment transaction. No duplicate PaymentID is allowed.
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setOrderNumber

        public PaymentParams.Builder setOrderNumber(java.lang.String orderNumber)
        Sets the order number.
        Parameters:
        orderNumber - Reference number / Invoice number for this order PaymentID must be unique but OrderNumber can be the same under different PaymentID, indicating multiple payment attempts are made on a particular order If Order Number is not applicable, please provide the same value as PaymentID
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setPaymentDesc

        public PaymentParams.Builder setPaymentDesc(java.lang.String paymentDesc)
        Sets the payment description.
        Parameters:
        paymentDesc - Order’s descriptions
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setMerchantReturnUrl

        public PaymentParams.Builder setMerchantReturnUrl(java.lang.String merchantReturnUrl)
        Sets the merchant return URL.
        Parameters:
        merchantReturnUrl - Merchant system’s browser redirect URL which receives payment response from eGHL when transaction is completed (approved/declined/system error/ cancelled by buyer on eGHL Payment Page) If MerchantApprovalURL is provided, when payment is approved, MerchantApprovalURL will be used instead of MerchantReturnURL If MerchantUnApprovalURL is provided, when payment is declined, MerchantUnApprovalURL will be used instead of MerchantReturnURL
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setAmount

        public PaymentParams.Builder setAmount(java.lang.String amount)
        Sets the amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - Payment amount in 2 decimal places regardless whether the currency has decimal places or not. Please exclude "," sign. e.g. 1000.00 for IDR Invalid format: 1,000.00 or 1000
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setB4TaxAmt

        public PaymentParams.Builder setB4TaxAmt(java.lang.String b4TaxAmt)
        Sets the before tax amount.
        Parameters:
        b4TaxAmt - Original amount before tax is incurred, in 2 decimal places regardless whether the currency has decimal places or not. As for final payment amount after tax is incurred, is to be specified in Amount field Please exclude "," sign. e.g. 1000.00 for IDR Invalid format: 1,000.00 or 1000
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setTaxAmt

        public PaymentParams.Builder setTaxAmt(java.lang.String taxAmt)
        Sets the tax amount.
        Parameters:
        taxAmt - Tax amount incurred Please exclude "," sign. e.g. 1000.00 for IDR Invalid format: 1,000.00 or 1000
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setMerchantApprovalUrl

        public PaymentParams.Builder setMerchantApprovalUrl(java.lang.String merchantApprovalUrl)
        Sets the merchant approval URL.
        Parameters:
        merchantApprovalUrl - URL to link to merchant’s website when payment is approved If not provided, MerchantReturnURL will be used
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setMerchantUnapprovalUrl

        public PaymentParams.Builder setMerchantUnapprovalUrl(java.lang.String merchantUnapprovalUrl)
        Sets the merchant Unapproval URL.
        Parameters:
        merchantUnapprovalUrl - URL to link to merchant’s website when payment is declined If not provided, MerchantReturnURL will be used
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setMerchantCallbackUrl

        public PaymentParams.Builder setMerchantCallbackUrl(java.lang.String merchantCallbackUrl)
        Sets the merchant callback URL.
        Parameters:
        merchantCallbackUrl - Server-to-server URL as an additional link to merchant’s website to be informed of transaction status This is useful when browser redirect URLs (MerchantReturnURL/MerchantApproval URL/MerchantUnApprovalURL) were not able to receive payment response due to buyer’s Internet connectivity problem or buyer closed browser Upon receiving response from Gateway, MerchantCallBackURL is to return an acknowledgement message "OK" to the Gateway or else Gateway will continue to send response to this URL for a maximum of 3 times
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setLanguageCode

        public PaymentParams.Builder setLanguageCode(java.lang.String languageCode)
        Sets the language code.
        Parameters:
        languageCode - Language Code for eGHL Payment Info Collection Page
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setPageTimeout

        public PaymentParams.Builder setPageTimeout(java.lang.String pageTimeout)
        Sets the page timeout.
        Parameters:
        pageTimeout - eGHL Payment Info Collection Page timeout in seconds Applicable for merchant system which would like to bring forward to Payment Gateway, the time remaining before product/order is released For example, a movie ticket sales page shows time remaining countdown from 15 minutes till 5 minutes. Upon customer’s clicking "checkout / proceed / pay" button, merchant system can then pass the value of (5 minutes x 60 seconds=300) seconds in this field to Gateway which will then continue the countdown from 5 minutes. Upon timeout, all entry fields and buttons on the Collection Page will be disabled
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setCardHolder

        public PaymentParams.Builder setCardHolder(java.lang.String cardHolder)
        Sets the card holder's name.
        Parameters:
        cardHolder - Cardholder’s Name. For PymtMethod "CC", if not provided, Payment Gateway will prompt this field on eGHL Payment Info Collection Page
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setCardNo

        public PaymentParams.Builder setCardNo(java.lang.String cardNo)
        Sets the card number.
        Parameters:
        cardNo - Credit Card Number used for payment authorization For PymtMethod "CC", if not provided, Payment Gateway will prompt this field on eGHL Payment Info Collection Page If merchant has own payment page to collect card information, merchant system is required to be PCI compliant
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setCardExp

        public PaymentParams.Builder setCardExp(java.lang.String cardExp)
        Sets the card expiry.
        Parameters:
        cardExp - Expiry date of credit card. Date format is YYYYMM, e.g. 201312 for year 2013 December For PymtMethod "CC", if not provided, Payment Gateway will prompt this field on eGHL Payment Info Collection Page
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setCardCvv2

        public PaymentParams.Builder setCardCvv2(java.lang.String cardCvv2)
        Sets the card CVV2.
        Parameters:
        cardCvv2 - 3-4 digits Card Verification Value available on the back of credit card For PymtMethod "CC", if not provided, Payment Gateway will prompt this field on eGHL Payment Info Collection Page
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setIssuingBank

        public PaymentParams.Builder setIssuingBank(java.lang.String issuingBank)
        Sets the issuing bank.
        Parameters:
        issuingBank - For PymtMethod "CC", this field indicates Bank which issued the credit card used for this transaction If not provided, Payment Gateway will prompt this field on eGHL Payment Info Collection Page For PymtMethod "DD", this field indicates Direct Debit banks/payment switches. If not provided, the list of Direct Debit/payment switches supported will be shown on eGHL Payment Info Collection Page
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setBillAddr

        public PaymentParams.Builder setBillAddr(java.lang.String billAddr)
        Sets the billing address.
        Parameters:
        billAddr - Billing Address (excludes postcode, town/city, state and country) For PymtMethod "CC", if not provided, Payment Gateway will prompt this field on eGHL Payment Info Collection Page
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • setToken

        public PaymentParams.Builder setToken(java.lang.String token)
        Sets the token value.
        Parameters:
        token - Token Value. If TokenType is specified, Token is expected to have value For TokenType OCP, this field is expecting the token value returned by eGHL in payment response For TokenType MPE, this field is expecting consumer’s Login ID to the merchant system
        Returns:
        Builder object with this value.

      • build

        public android.os.Bundle build()
        Builds all the parameters that you've set into a Bundle object.
        Returns:
        A Bundle object with all the values you've set. The default values for all the fields are empty strings.
